url.title: Link URL
url.description: The interstitial link url. This is where the user should be taken if they follow this link.

content.title: Link Title
content.description: The interstitial link title text. This text should be considered part of the link.

description.title: Link Description
description.description: Additional text about the link. May or may not be considered part of the link, depending on implementation.

image.title: Link Image
image.description: An optional image. This should be considered part of the link.

..\\traits\\trait_id.json.title: Globally Unique ID trait
..\\traits\\trait_id.json.description: A globally unique identifier of the content in the ANS repository.

..\\traits\\trait_subtype.json.title: Subtype or Template
..\\traits\\trait_subtype.json.description: A user-defined categorization method to supplement type. In Arc, this field is reserved for organization-defined purposes, such as selecting the PageBuilder template that should be used to render a document.

..\\traits\\trait_channel.json.title: Channel trait
..\\traits\\trait_channel.json.description: An optional list of output types for which this element should be visible

..\\traits\\trait_alignment.json.title: Alignment
..\\traits\\trait_alignment.json.description: A property used to determine horizontal positioning of a content element relative to the elements that immediately follow it in the element sequence.

..\\traits\\trait_additional_properties..title: Has additional properties
..\\traits\\trait_additional_properties..description: A grab-bag object for non-validatable data.

..\\image.json.title: An image.
..\\image.json.description: Holds attributes of an ANS image component. In the Arc ecosystem, these are stored in Anglerfish.

licensable.description: True if the image can legally be licensed to others.

..\\traits\\trait_version.json.title: Describes the ANS version of this object
..\\traits\\trait_version.json.description: The version of ANS that this object was serialized as, in major.minor.patch format.  For top-level content objects, this is a required trait.

..\\traits\\trait_locale.json.title: Describes language for an element
..\\traits\\trait_locale.json.description: The primary language of the content. The value should follow IETF BCP47. (e.g. 'en', 'es-419', etc.)

..\\traits\\trait_copyright.json.title: Copyright information
..\\traits\\trait_copyright.json.description: A copyright notice for the legal owner of this content. E.g., 'Â© 1996-2018 The Washington Post.' Format may vary between organizations.

..\\traits\\trait_canonical_url.json.title: Canonical URL
..\\traits\\trait_canonical_url.json.description: The relative URL to this document on the website specified by the `canonical_website` field. In the Arc ecosystem, this will be populated by the content api from the arc-canonical-url service if present based on the canonical_website. In conjunction with canonical_website, it can be used to determine the SEO canonical url or open graph url. In a multi-site context, this field may be different from the website_url field.

..\\traits\\trait_short_url.json.title: Short_Url
..\\traits\\trait_short_url.json.description: A url-shortened version of the canonical url.

..\\traits\\trait_created_date.json.title: Created Date
..\\traits\\trait_created_date.json.description: When the content was originally created (RFC3339-formatted). In the Arc ecosystem, this will be automatically generated for stories in the Story API.

..\\traits\\trait_last_updated_date.json.title: Last Updated Date
..\\traits\\trait_last_updated_date.json.description: When the content was last updated (RFC3339-formatted).

..\\traits\\trait_first_publish_date.jso.title: First Publish Date
..\\traits\\trait_first_publish_date.jso.description: When the story was first published.

..\\traits\\trait_display_date.json.title: Display_Date
..\\traits\\trait_display_date.json.description: The RFC3339-formatted dated time of the most recent date the story was (re)displayed on a public site.

..\\traits\\trait_location.json.title: Location related trait
..\\traits\\trait_location.json.description: A description of the location, useful if a full address or lat/long specification is overkill.

..\\traits\\trait_geo.json.title: Geo
..\\traits\\trait_geo.json.description: Latitidue and Longitude of the content

..\\traits\\trait_address.json.title: Address
..\\traits\\trait_address.json.description: An Address following the convention of http://microformats.org/wiki/hcard

..\\traits\\trait_editor_note.json.title: Editor_Note
..\\traits\\trait_editor_note.json.description: Additional information to be displayed near the content from the editor.

..\\traits\\trait_status.json.title: Status
..\\traits\\trait_status.json.description: Optional field to story story workflow related status (e.g. published/embargoed/etc)

..\\traits\\trait_headlines.json.title: Headlines
..\\traits\\trait_headlines.json.description: The headline(s) or title for this content.  The 'basic' key is required.

..\\traits\\trait_description.json.title: Description
..\\traits\\trait_description.json.description: The descriptions, or blurbs, for the content.

..\\traits\\trait_credits.json.title: Credit trait
..\\traits\\trait_credits.json.description: A list of people and groups attributed to this content, keyed by type of contribution. In the Arc ecosystem, references in this list will be denormalized into author objects from the arc-author-service.

by.title: By
by.description: The primary author(s) of this document. For a story, is is the writer or reporter. For an image, it is the photographer.

photos_by.title: Photos by
photos_by.description: The photographer(s) of supplementary images included in this document, if it is a story. Note that if this document is an image, the photographer(s) should appear in the 'by' slot.

..\\utils\\author.json.title: An author of a piece of content.
..\\utils\\author.json.description: Models attribution to an individual or group for contribution towards some content item. In the Arc ecosystem, these are stored in the arc-author-service.

type.description: Indicates that this is an author

name.title: Name
name.description: The full human name of contributor. See also byline, first_name, last_name, middle_name, suffix.

url.description: A link to an author's landing page on the website, or a personal website.

first_name.title: First Name
first_name.description: The real first name of a human author.

middle_name.title: Middle Name
middle_name.description: The real middle name of a human author.

last_name.title: Last Name
last_name.description: The real last name of a human author.

suffix.title: Suffix
suffix.description: The real suffix of a human author.

byline.title: Byline
byline.description: The public-facing name, or nom-de-plume, name of the author.

location.title: Location
location.description: The city or locality that the author resides in or is primarily associated with.

division.title: Division
division.description: The desk or group that this author normally reports to. E.g., 'Politics' or 'Sports.'

email.title: E-mail
email.description: The professional email address of this author.

role.title: Role
role.description: The organizational role or title of this author.

expertise.title: Expertise
expertise.description: A comma-delimited list of subjects the author in which the author has expertise.

affiliation.title: Affiliation
affiliation.description: The name of an organization the author is affiliated with. E.g., The Washington Post, or George Mason University.

languages.title: Languages
languages.description: A description of list of languages that the author is somewhat fluent in, excluding the native language of the parent publication, and identified in the language of the parent publication. E.g., Russian, Japanese, Greek.

bio.title: Short Biography
bio.description: A one or two sentence description of the author.

long_bio.title: Long Biography
long_bio.description: The full biography of the author.

books.title: Books
books.description: A list of books written by the author.

book_url.title: URL
book_url.description: A link to a page to purchase or learn more about the book.

education.title: Education
education.description: A list of schools that this author has graduated from.

awards.title: Awards
awards.description: A list of awards the author has received.

contributor.title: Contributor
contributor.description: If true, this author is an external contributor to the publication.

org.title: Org
org.description: Deprecated. In ANS 0.5.8 and prior versions, this field is populated with the 'location' field from Arc Author Service. New implementations should use the 'location' and 'affiliation' field. Content should be identical to 'location.'

socialLinks.description: Deperecated. Included for backwards-compatibility. Content should be identical to social_links.

..\\traits\\trait_slug.json.title: Slug
..\\traits\\trait_slug.json.description: A short reference name for internal editorial use

..\\utils\\reference.json.title: Representation of a normalized element
..\\utils\\reference.json.description: This represents a reference to external content that should be denormalized

type.description: The ANS type that the provider should return.

service.description: The type of interaction the provider expects. E.g., 'oembed'

id.description: The id passed to the provider to retrieve an ANS document

provider.description: A URL that can resolve the id into an ANS element

website.description: The website which the referenced id belongs to. Currently supported only for sections.

referent_properties.description: An object for key-value pairs that should override the values of keys with the same name in the denormalized object

..\\traits\\trait_vanity_credits.json.title: Vanity Credits trait
..\\traits\\trait_vanity_credits.json.description: Similar to the credits trait, but to be used only when ANS is being directly rendered to readers natively. For legal and technical reasons, the `credits` trait is preferred when converting ANS into feeds or other distribution formats. However, when present, `vanity_credits` allows more sophisticated credits presentation to override the default without losing that original data.

by.title: By
by.description: The primary author(s) of this document. For a story, is is the writer or reporter. For an image, it is the photographer.

photos_by.title: Photos by
photos_by.description: The photographer(s) of supplementary images included in this document, if it is a story. Note that if this document is an image, the photographer(s) should appear in the 'by' slot.

..\\traits\\trait_taxonomy.json.title: Taxonomy
..\\traits\\trait_taxonomy.json.description: Holds the collection of tags, categories, keywords, etc that describe content.

keywords.description: A list of keywords. In the Arc ecosystem, this list is populated by Clavis.

named_entities.description: A list of named entities. In the Arc ecosystem, this list is populated by Clavis.

topics.description: A list of topics. In the Arc ecosystem, this list is populated by Clavis.

auxiliaries.description: A list of auxiliaries. In the Arc ecosystem, this list is populated by Clavis.

primary_site.description: Deprecated in 0.10.0. (See `primary_section` instead.) A primary site object or reference to one. In the Arc ecosystem, a reference here is denormalized into a site from the arc-site-service.

primary_section.description: A primary section object or reference to one. In the Arc ecosystem, a reference here is denormalized into a site from the arc-site-service.

sites.description: Deprecated in 0.10.0. (See `sections` instead.) A list of site objects or references to them. In the Arc ecosystem, references in this list are denormalized into sites from the arc-site-service.  In a multi-site context, sites will be denormalized against an organization's default website only.

sections.description: A list of site objects or references to them. In the Arc ecosystem, references in this list are denormalized into sites from the arc-site-service.  In a multi-site context, sites will be denormalized against an organization's default website only.

seo_keywords.description: A list of user-editable manually entered keywords for search purposes. In the Arc ecosystem, these can be generated and saved in source CMS systems, editors, etc.

stock_symbols.description: A list of stock symbols of companies related to this content. In the Arc ecosystem, these can be generated and saved in source CMS systems, editors, etc.

associated_tasks.description: A list of WebSked task IDs that this content was created or curated to satisfy.

..\\utils\\keyword.json.title: Keyword
..\\utils\\keyword.json.description: Models a keyword used in describing a piece of content.

keyword.description: The keyword used to describe a piece of content

score.description: An arbitrary weighting to give the keyword

tag.description: The Part of Speech tag for this keyword.

frequency.description: An optional count of the frequency of the keyword as it appears in the content it describes

..\\utils\\named_entity.json.title: Named Entity
..\\utils\\named_entity.json.description: Models a named entity (i.e. name of a person, place, or organization) used in a piece of content.

_id.description: A unique identifier for the concept of the named entity.

name.description: The actual string of text that was identified as a named entity.

type.description: A description of what the named entity is. E.g. 'organization', 'person', or 'location'.

score.decription: An optional relevancy for this named entitiy.

..\\utils\\topic.json.title: Topic
..\\utils\\topic.json.description: Models a topic used in describing a piece of content.

_id.description: The unique identifier for this topic.

name.description: The general name for this topic.

score.description: An arbitrary weighting to give the topic

uid.description: A short identifier for this topic. Usually used in cases where a long form id cannot work.

..\\utils\\auxiliary.json.title: Auxiliary
..\\utils\\auxiliary.json.description: Models a auxiliary used in targeting a piece of content.

_id.description: The unique identifier for this auxiliary.

name.description: The general name for this auxiliary.

uid.description: A short identifier for this auxiliary. Usually used in cases where a long form id cannot work.

..\\utils\\tag.json.title: Tag
..\\utils\\tag.json.description: Models a keyword used in describing a piece of content.

text.description: The text of the tag as displayed to users.

description.description: A more detailed description of the tag.

..\\utils\\site.json.title: Site
..\\utils\\site.json.description: A hierarchical section or 'site' in a taxonomy. In the Arc ecosystem, these are stored in the arc-site-service.

description.description: A short description or tagline about this site

path.description: The url path to this site

parent_id.description: The id of this section's parent site, if any

..\\utils\\section.json.title: Section
..\\utils\\section.json.description: A hierarchical section in a taxonomy. In the Arc ecosystem, these are stored in the arc-site-service.

description.description: A short description or tagline about this site

path.description: The url path to this site

parent_id.description: The id of this section's parent section in the default hierarchy, if any.

parent.description: The id of this section's parent section in various commonly-used hierarchies, where available.

..\\traits\\trait_website.json.title: Website
..\\traits\\trait_website.json.description: The _id of the website on which this document exists. This field is only available in Content API. If different from canonical_website, then this document was originally sourced from the canonical_website. Generated at fetch time by Content API.

..\\traits\\trait_promo_items.json.title: Promo Items
..\\traits\\trait_promo_items.json.description: Lists of promotional content to use when highlighting the story. In the Arc ecosystem, references in these lists will be denormalized.

..\\content.json.title: A content object.
..\\content.json.description: Holds common attributes of ANS Content objects.

..\\traits\\trait_related_content.json.title: Related_Content
..\\traits\\trait_related_content.json.description: Lists of content items or references this story is related to, arbitrarily keyed. In the Arc ecosystem, references in this object will be denormalized into the fully-inflated content objects they represent.

redirect.description: An attached redirect. In Arc, when this content item is fetched by url, content api will instead return this redirect object with appropriate headers.  In all other cases, this content should be treated normally.

..\\traits\\trait_owner.json.title: Owner information
..\\traits\\trait_owner.json.description: Various unrelated fields that should be preserved for backwards-compatibility reasons. See also trait_source.

id.description: The machine-readable unique identifier of the organization whose database this content is stored in. In Arc, this is equivalent to ARC_ORG_NAME.

name.description: Deprecated in 0.10.0. See `distributor.name`. (Formerly: The human-readable name of original producer of content. Distinguishes between Wires, Staff and other sources.)

sponsored.description: True if this content is advertorial or native advertising.

..\\traits\\trait_revision.json.title: Revision
..\\traits\\trait_revision.json.description: Trait that applies revision information to a document. In the Arc ecosystem, many of these fields are populated in stories by the Story API.

revision_id.description: The unique id of this revision.

parent_id.description: The unique id of the revision that this revisions was branched from, or preceded it on the current branch.

branch.description: The name of the branch this revision was created on.

editions.description: A list of identifiers of editions that point to this revision.

user_id.description: The unique user id of the person who created this revision.

published.description: Whether or not this revision's parent story is published, in any form or place

..\\traits\\trait_planning.json.title: Scheduling information
..\\traits\\trait_planning.json.description: Trait that applies planning information to a document or resource. In the Arc ecosystem, this data is generated by WebSked. Newsroom use only. All these fields should be available and editable in WebSked.

websked_sort_date.description: Date to be used for chronological sorting in WebSked.

deadline_miss.description: The delta between the story's planned publish date and actual first publish time, in minutes.

internal_note.title: Internal Note
internal_note.description: This note is used for shared communication inside the newsroom.

budget_line.title: Budget Line
budget_line.description: Used for the newsroom to identify what the story is about, especially if a user is unfamiliar with the slug of a story and the headline or they do not yet exist. Newsroom use only.

planned_publish_date.description: When the content is planned to be published.

scheduled_publish_date.description: When the content was first published.

word_count_planned.description: The anticipated number of words in the story.

inch_count_planned.description: The anticipated length of the story in inches.

inch_count_actual.description: The current length of the story in inches.

line_count_planned.description: The anticipated length of the story in lines.

line_count_actual.description: The current length of the story in lines.

..\\traits\\trait_workflow.json.title: Workflow information
..\\traits\\trait_workflow.json.description: Trait that applies workflow information to a document or resource. In the Arc ecosystem, this data is generated by WebSked.

status_code.description: Code indicating the story's current workflow status. This number should match the values configured in WebSked.

note.description: This note will be used for any task automatically generated via WebSked task triggers.

..\\traits\\trait_pitches.json.title: Pitches
..\\traits\\trait_pitches.json.description: Trait that represents a story's pitches. In the Arc ecosystem, this data is generated by WebSked.

platform.description: A list of the story's pitches to a platform.

publication.description: A list of the story's pitches to a publication.

..\\traits\\trait_platform_pitch.json.title: Platform pitch
..\\traits\\trait_platform_pitch.json.description: Trait that represents a pitch to a platform. In the Arc ecosystem, this data is generated by WebSked.

platform_path.description: The path of the platform that this pitch targets.

..\\traits\\trait_platform_pitch_event.j.title: Platform pitch event
..\\traits\\trait_platform_pitch_event.j.description: Trait that represents an update event for a pitch to a platform. In the Arc ecosystem, this data is generated by WebSked.

status.description: The current status of the pitch.

user_id.description: The ID of the user who made this update.

note.description: Optional note associated with this update.

..\\traits\\trait_publication_pitch.json.title: Publication pitch
..\\traits\\trait_publication_pitch.json.description: Trait that represents a pitch to a publication. In the Arc ecosystem, this data is generated by WebSked.

publication_id.description: The ID of the publication that this pitch targets.

..\\traits\\trait_publication_pitch_even.title: Publication pitch event
..\\traits\\trait_publication_pitch_even.description: Trait that represents an update event for a pitch to a publication. In the Arc ecosystem, this data is generated by WebSked.

status.description: The current status of the pitch.

user_id.description: The ID of the user who made this update.

note.description: Optional note associated with this update.

edition_id.description: The ID of the publication edition that this pitch targets.

edition_time.description: The time of the publication edition that this pitch targets.

..\\traits\\trait_syndication.json.title: Syndication
..\\traits\\trait_syndication.json.description: Key-boolean pair of syndication services where this article may go

external_distribution.description: Necessary for fulfilling contractual agreements with third party Globe and Mail clients

search.description: Necessary so that we can filter out all articles that editorial has deemed should not be discoverable via search

..\\traits\\trait_source.json.title: Source
..\\traits\\trait_source.json.description: Information about the original source and/or owner of this content

source_id.description: The id of this content in a foreign CMS.

source_type.description: Deprecated in 0.10.0. See `distributor.category` and `distributor.subcategory`. (Formerly: The method used to enter this content. E.g. 'staff', 'wires'.)

name.description: Deprecated in  0.10.0. See `distributor.name`. (Formerly: The human-readable name of the organization who first produced this content. E.g., 'Reuters'.)

system.description: The software (CMS or editor) that was used to enter this content. E.g., 'wordpress', 'ellipsis'.

edit_url.description: A link to edit this content in its source CMS.

..\\traits\\trait_distributor.json.title: Distributor
..\\traits\\trait_distributor.json.description: Information about a third party that provided this content from outside this document's hosted organization.

name.description: The human-readable name of the distributor of this content. E.g., Reuters.

category.description: The machine-readable category of how this content was produced. Use 'staff' if this content was produced by an employee of the organization who owns this document repository. (Multisite note: content produced within a single *organization*, but shared across multiple *websites* should still be considered 'staff.') Use âwiresâ if this content was produced for another organization and shared with the one who owns this document repository. Use 'freelance' if this content was produced by an individual on behalf of the organization who owns this document repository. Use 'stock' if this content is stock media distributed directly from a stock media provider. Use 'handout' if this is content provided from a source for an article (usually promotional media distributed directly from a company). Use 'other' for all other cases.

subcategory.description: The machine-readable subcategory of how this content was produced. E.g., 'freelance - signed'. May vary between organizations.

reference_id.description: The ARC UUID of the distributor of this content. E.g., ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ.

comments_period.description: How long (in days) after publish date until comments are closed.

allow_comments.description: If false, commenting is disabled on this content.

display_comments.description: If false, do not render comments on this content.

moderation_required.description: If true, comments must be moderator-approved before being displayed.

..\\traits\\trait_label.json.title: Label
..\\traits\\trait_label.json.description: What the Washington Post calls a Kicker

basic.description: The default label object for this piece of content.

url.description: An optional destination url of this label.

display.description: If false, this label should be hidden.

url.description: An optional destination url of this label.

display.description: If false, this label should be hidden.

..\\traits\\trait_content_restrictions.j.title: Content Restrictions
..\\traits\\trait_content_restrictions.j.description: Trait that applies contains the content restrictions of an ANS object.

content_code.description: The content restriction code/level/flag associated with the ANS object

embargo.description: Embargo configuration to enforce publishing restrictions. Embargoed content must not go live.

active.description: The boolean flag to indicate if the embargo is active or not. If this field is false, ignore the embargo.

end_time.description: An optional end time for the embargo to indicate when it ends. When it's not defined, it means the embargo keeps applying. The end time should be ignored if active flag is false.

description.description: An optional description for the embargo.

..\\traits\\trait_content_aliases.json.title: Aliases trait
..\\traits\\trait_content_aliases.json.description: An list of alternate names that this content can be fetched by instead of id.

..\\traits\\trait_image_type.json.title: Image Type
..\\traits\\trait_image_type.json.description: A more specific category for an image.

category.description: The machine-readable enumeration of valid image types.

..\\traits\\trait_alt_text.json.title: Alt Text
..\\traits\\trait_alt_text.json.description: The direct ANS equivalent of the HTML 'alt' attribute. A description of the contents of an image for improved accessibility.
